content.description: Starts on small holds but good knobs and becomes balancy as the knobs get further and smaller apart. Good holds half way up you  make a fun reach that makes this problem entertaining.  Good problem that is a great warm up and a problem not to over look.
content.location: First problem  on the right of Woodpecker Protrusion starts by the Pine tree.

content.description: Mutha Jugs follows huge knobs to the top. When facing the protrusion this route is about halfway up the middle of the proper protrusion. Don't let the grade make one move on. This is a great route that deserves some attention. Only Route that I really wish to post on this fun formation.
content.protection: 2 crashpads would be nice. FA didn't have pads.

climbs.name: The Awakening- AKA Woodpecker Protrusion Direct

content.description: This route is Awesome!!  The original crack line was good however Luke Ross had an "Awakening " and saw the direct finish- truly making it a Black Hills Classic ! I had pleasure of helping him bolt this amazing line.   Two bolts lead to a slightly overhanging hand crack- having 3 #3 cammalots is the ideal rack but you can get by with 2 and double #2's- singles on the rest- slinging your gear is helpful for rope drag. The crack narrows to fingers then bolts on the face head wall. Save a medium piece in between last bolt and anchors. Many different cruxes will test all of your climbing skills-
content.protection: 6 bolts, stoppers, .3 -#3 Cammalot - extra # 3's helpfull   2 bolt Anchor at top   A 70 meter rope will just barely get you down- WATCH your ends!!
content.location: From parking spot follow trail west- turn right -N-and go down the hill just before the sledgehammer- you will pass Knife in a Gunfight-on your left -as you walk down hill Rain Shadow Boulder will be on your right- continue around the Boulder heading east now you can't miss this Amazing Splitter!!

content.description: Obvious Protrusion up the hill from parking.
